00140 /*--------------------------
00141  *    Timer management.
00142  *-------------------------*/
00143 
00144 /* start time */
00145 static struct timeval timer_start = {0,0};
00146 
00147 /* stop time */
00148 static struct timeval timer_end = {0,0};
00149 
00150 /* timer state (0=OFF, 1=ON) */
00151 static int timer_state = 0;
00152 
00153 
00154 
00155 /* The timer command */
00156 
00157 int util_timer( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00158                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00159                 FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00160               )
00161 {
00162   
00163   
00164       if (argc != 2)
00165       {
00166         fprintf(output,"Usage: %s start|print|stop.\n",argv[0]);
00167         return -1;
00168       }
00169       
00170       /* Timer start command */
00171       
00172       if (!strcmp(argv[1],"start")){
00173         
00174         if ( timer_state ){
00175           fprintf(output,"Timer already started.\n");
00176           return -1;
00177         }
00178         
00179         if ( gettimeofday(&timer_start,NULL)== -1 ){
00180           fprintf(output,"Error retrieving system time.\n");
00181           return -1;
00182         }
00183         
00184         fprintf( output,"Timer start time: " );
00185         print_timeval( output, timer_start );
00186         
00187         timer_state = 1;
00188         return 0;
00189       }
00190       
00191       
00192       /* Timer stop command */
00193       
00194       if ( !strcmp(argv[1],"stop") )
00195       {
00196         
00197         if (!timer_state)
00198         {
00199           fprintf(output,"Timer is not started.\n");
00200           return -1;
00201         }
00202         
00203         if ( gettimeofday(&timer_end,NULL)== -1 )
00204         {
00205           fprintf(output,"Error retrieving system time.\n");
00206           return -1;
00207         }
00208         
00209         fprintf(output,"Timer stop time: ");
00210         print_timeval( output, timer_end );
00211         
00212         timer_state = 0;
00213         return 0;
00214       }
00215       
00216       
00217       /* Timer print command */
00218       
00219       if ( !strcmp(argv[1],"print") )
00220       {
00221         
00222         if ( timer_state )
00223         {
00224           
00225           struct timeval timer_tmp;
00226           
00227           /* timer is running, print current enlapsed time */
00228           if ( gettimeofday(&timer_tmp,NULL)== -1 )
00229           {
00230             fprintf(output,"Error retrieving system time.\n");
00231             return -1;
00232           }
00233           
00234           timer_tmp = time_diff( timer_start,timer_tmp );
00235           print_timeval( output, timer_tmp );
00236           
00237         } else {
00238           
00239           struct timeval timer_tmp;
00240           
00241           timer_tmp = time_diff( timer_start, timer_end );
00242           print_timeval( output, timer_tmp );
00243           
00244         }
00245         return 0;
00246       }
00247       
00248       /* unknown timer command */
00249       fprintf(output,"Usage: %s start|print|stop.\n",argv[0]);
00250       return -1;  
00251   
00252 } /* util_timer */

00257 /*--------------------------
00258  *      System utils.
00259  *-------------------------*/
00260 
00261 
00262 int util_sleep( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00263                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00264                 FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00265               )
00266 {
00267   
00268       unsigned long sleep_time;        
00269       int rc;
00270       
00271       if (argc != 2)
00272       {        
00273         fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <int value>\n",argv[0]);
00274         return -1;        
00275       }
00276 
00277       /* conversion */
00278       rc = my_atoi( argv[1] );
00279 
00280       if ( rc<0 )
00281       {
00282         fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <int value> (%s is not a positive integer)\n",argv[0],argv[1]);
00283         return -1;
00284       }
00285 
00286       sleep_time = ( unsigned long ) rc;
00287 
00288       fprintf( output,"sleep: suspending execution for %lu s...\n", sleep_time);
00289 
00290       /* sleeping */
00291 
00292       sleep(sleep_time);
00293 
00294       
00295       return 0;
00296   
00297 }

00301 
00302 int util_shell( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00303                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00304                 FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00305               )
00306 {
00307   
00308   FILE * cmd_output;
00309   int i;
00310   char command_line[1024] = "";
00311   char buffer[1024];
00312 
00313   if ( argc < 2 )
00314   {
00315     fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <shell_cmd> [arg1 arg2 ...]\n",argv[0]);
00316     return -1;
00317   }
00318 
00319     
00320   /* builds the command line */
00321   
00322   for ( i = 1; i <argc ; i++ )
00323   {
00324     strncat( command_line, argv[i], 1024 );
00325     if ( i != argc - 1 )
00326       strncat( command_line, " ", 1024 );
00327   }
00328   
00329   /* launch the command */
00330   
00331   cmd_output = popen( command_line, "r" );
00332   
00333   if ( cmd_output == NULL )
00334   {
00335     fprintf( output,"shell: popen error %d\n", errno );
00336     return -1;
00337   }
00338   
00339   /* copy the shell ouput to the command output stream */
00340   
00341   while ( fgets( buffer, sizeof(buffer), cmd_output ) != NULL )
00342   {    
00343     fputs( buffer, output );    
00344   }
00345   
00346   /* get returned status */
00347   
00348   return pclose( cmd_output );  
00349   
00350 } /* util_shell */

00354 
00355 int util_meminfo( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00356                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00357                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00358                  )
00359 {
00360 #if( !defined( _APPLE ) && !defined( _SOLARIS ) )
00361 
00362 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00363   buddy_stats_t bstats;
00364 #endif
00365         
00366   /* standard mallinfo */
00367   
00368   struct mallinfo meminfo = mallinfo();
00369   
00370   fprintf(output, "Mallinfo:\n");
00371   
00372   fprintf(output, "   Total space in arena: %lu\n", (unsigned long)meminfo.arena );
00373   fprintf(output, "   Number of ordinary blocks: %d\n", meminfo.ordblks );
00374   fprintf(output, "   Number of small blocks: %d\n", meminfo.smblks );
00375   fprintf(output, "   Number of holding blocks: %d\n", meminfo.hblks );
00376   fprintf(output, "   Space in holding block headers: %d\n", meminfo.hblkhd );
00377   fprintf(output, "   Space in small blocks in use: %lu\n", (unsigned long)meminfo.usmblks );
00378   fprintf(output, "   Space in free small blocks: %lu\n", (unsigned long)meminfo.fsmblks );
00379   fprintf(output, "   Space in ordinary blocks in use: %lu\n", (unsigned long)meminfo.uordblks );
00380   fprintf(output, "   Space in free ordinary blocks: %lu\n", (unsigned long)meminfo.fordblks );
00381   fprintf(output, "   Cost of enabling keep option: %d\n", meminfo.keepcost );  
00382   fprintf(output,"\n");
00383   
00384 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00385   
00386   BuddyGetStats( &bstats ) ;
00387   
00388   fprintf(output, "Buddy info (thread %p):\n",(caddr_t)pthread_self() );
00389   /* Buddy sytem info */
00390   
00391   fprintf( output, "Total Space in Arena: %lu  (Watermark: %lu)\n",(unsigned long)bstats.TotalMemSpace,
00392                                                                    (unsigned long)bstats.WM_TotalMemSpace );
00393   fprintf( output, "\n" );
00394   
00395   fprintf( output, "Total Space for Standard Pages: %lu  (Watermark: %lu)\n",(unsigned long)bstats.StdMemSpace,
00396                                                                      (unsigned long)bstats.WM_StdMemSpace );
00397   
00398   fprintf( output, "      Nb Standard Pages: %lu\n",(unsigned long)bstats.NbStdPages );
00399   
00400   fprintf( output, "      Size of Std Pages: %lu\n",(unsigned long)bstats.StdPageSize );
00401   
00402 
00403   fprintf( output, "      Space Used inside Std Pages: %lu  (Watermark: %lu)\n",(unsigned long)bstats.StdUsedSpace, 
00404                                                                      (unsigned long)bstats.WM_StdUsedSpace );
00405 
00406           
00407   fprintf( output, "      Nb of Std Pages Used: %lu  (Watermark: %lu)\n",(unsigned long)bstats.NbStdUsed ,
00408                                                                      (unsigned long)bstats.WM_NbStdUsed );
00409   
00410   if ( bstats.NbStdUsed > 0 )
00411   {
00412   fprintf( output, "      Memory Fragmentation: %.2f %%\n",
00413              100.0 - ( 100.0 * bstats.StdUsedSpace / ( 1.0 * bstats.NbStdUsed * bstats.StdPageSize )) );
00414   }
00415   
00416   fprintf( output, "\n" );  
00417   
00418   
00419 #endif
00420 
00421 #endif /* _APPLE */  
00422   return 0;
00423   
00424   
00425 } /* util_meminfo */

00429 /*----------------------
00430  *    String utils.
00431  *----------------------*/
00432 
00433 int util_cmp( int argc ,        /* IN : number of args in argv */
00434              char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00435              FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00436             )
00437 {
00438   
00439   static char * format = "hinv";
00440   static char * help_cmp =
00441       "Usage: %s [ -h | -i | -n | -v ]  <expr1> <expr2>\n"
00442       "     -h: print this help\n"
00443       "     -i: case insensitive comparison\n"
00444       "     -n: numerical comparison\n"
00445       "     -v: verbose mode\n";
00446   
00447   int err_flag = 0; /* error parsing options */
00448   int flag_h = 0; /* help */
00449   int flag_i = 0; /* case insensitive compare */
00450   int flag_n = 0; /* numerical compare */
00451   int flag_v = 0; /* verbose */
00452   
00453   int rc, option;
00454     
00455   char * str1 = NULL;  /* arg1 */
00456   char * str2 = NULL;  /* arg2 */
00457   
00458   /* the value to been returned, according to argv[0] */
00459   int value_if_equal = FALSE;
00460   
00461   if (!strcmp(argv[0],"eq")) value_if_equal = TRUE;
00462   else if (!strcmp(argv[0],"ne")) value_if_equal = FALSE;
00463   else if (!strcmp(argv[0],"cmp")) value_if_equal = FALSE;
00464   /* unexpected !!! */
00465   else exit(1);
00466   
00467   /* disables Getopt error message */
00468   Opterr = 0;
00469   
00470   /* reinits Getopt processing */
00471   Optind = 1;
00472 
00473   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1)
00474   {   
00475     switch(option)
00476     {
00477       case 'h':
00478         if (flag_h)
00479           fprintf(output,
00480               "%s: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n",argv[0] );
00481         else flag_h ++;
00482         break;
00483         
00484       case 'i':
00485         if (flag_i)
00486           fprintf(output,
00487               "%s: warning: option 'i' has been specified more than once.\n",argv[0] );
00488         else flag_i ++;
00489         break;
00490         
00491       case 'n':
00492         if (flag_n)
00493           fprintf(output,
00494               "%s: warning: option 'n' has been specified more than once.\n",argv[0] );
00495         else flag_n ++;
00496         break;
00497         
00498       case 'v':
00499         if (flag_v)
00500           fprintf(output,
00501               "%s: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n",argv[0] );
00502         else flag_v ++;
00503         break;
00504         
00505       case '?':
00506         fprintf(output,"%s: unknown option : %c\n",argv[0],Optopt);
00507         err_flag ++;
00508         break;
00509     }    
00510   }
00511 
00512   /* help flag */  
00513   if ( flag_h )
00514   {
00515     fprintf( output, help_cmp, argv[0] );
00516     return -1;
00517   }
00518 
00519   /* check conflicts */
00520   if ( flag_i + flag_n > 1 )
00521   {
00522     fprintf( output,"%s: conflict between options -i, -n\n",argv[0] );
00523     err_flag++;
00524   }
00525 
00526   
00527   /* check arg number */  
00528   if ( Optind != (argc-2) )
00529   {
00530     /* too much or not enough arguments */
00531     err_flag ++;
00532   }
00533   else
00534   {
00535     str1 = argv[Optind];
00536     str2 = argv[Optind+1];
00537   }
00538   
00539   /* error */
00540   if (err_flag)
00541   {
00542     fprintf(output,help_cmp,argv[0]);
00543     return -1;
00544   }
00545   
00546   
00547   if ( !flag_i && !flag_n )
00548   {
00549     /* normal comparison */
00550     rc = strcmp( str1, str2 );
00551   }
00552   else if ( flag_i )
00553   {
00554     /* case insensitive comparison */
00555     rc = strcasecmp( str1, str2 );
00556   }
00557   else if ( flag_n )
00558   {
00559     int a,b;
00560     
00561     
00562     if (str1[0]=='-')
00563       a = my_atoi( str1+1 );
00564     else
00565       a = my_atoi( str1 );
00566     
00567     if ( a<0 )
00568     {
00569       fprintf(output, "cmp: invalid integer value %s\n", str1 );
00570       return -1;
00571     }
00572     
00573     if (str1[0]=='-') a = -a;
00574     
00575     if (str2[0]=='-')
00576       b = my_atoi( str2+1 );
00577     else
00578       b = my_atoi( str2 );
00579     
00580     if ( b<0 )
00581     {
00582       fprintf(output, "cmp: invalid integer value %s\n", str2 );
00583       return -1;
00584     }
00585     
00586     if (str2[0]=='-') b = -b;
00587     
00588     rc = b-a ;
00589     
00590   }
00591     
00592     
00593   /* return values */
00594         
00595   if ( rc == 0 )
00596   {
00597     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"arg1 = arg2\n" );
00598     
00599     return value_if_equal;
00600   }
00601   else
00602   {
00603     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"arg1 <> arg2\n" );
00604     
00605     return (!value_if_equal) ;
00606   }
00607   
00608 } /* util_cmp */
00609 
00610 
00611 
00612 /* diff 2 strings line by line */
00613 
00614 static void diff(FILE * output, char * str1, char * str2){
00615 
00616   /* current lines,chars */
00617   char * str_line1;
00618   char * char1;
00619   char * str_line2;
00620   char * char2;
00621   
00622   str_line1=str1;
00623   str_line2=str2;
00624   
00625   do {
00626   
00627     char1=str_line1;
00628     char2=str_line2;
00629   
00630     while (*char1 == *char2)
00631     {
00632       if ((*char1 == '\0') || (*char1 == '\n'))  break;
00633             
00634       char1++;
00635       char2++;    
00636     }
00637     
00638     /* different ? */
00639     if (*char1 != *char2)
00640     {
00641             
00642       /* prints from the beggining of the line to the end */
00643       if (*str_line1) fprintf(output, "\t<- ");    
00644       
00645       while ( (*str_line1) && (*str_line1 != '\n'))
00646       {
00647         putc(*str_line1,output);
00648         str_line1++;
00649       }
00650       
00651       /* skip the final \n  */
00652       if (*str_line1) str_line1++;
00653       
00654       if (*str_line2) fprintf(output,"\n\t-> ");
00655       
00656       while ( (*str_line2) && (*str_line2 != '\n'))
00657       {
00658         putc(*str_line2,output);
00659         str_line2++;
00660       }
00661       /* skip the final \n  */
00662       if (*str_line2) str_line2++;
00663       
00664       putc('\n',output);
00665 
00666     }
00667     else if (*char1 == '\n')
00668     {      
00669       /* end of line */
00670       str_line1 = char1 + 1;
00671       str_line2 = char2 + 1;
00672     }
00673     else 
00674     {
00675       /* end of file */
00676       break;
00677     }
00678   
00679   } while(1);
00680   
00681   return;
00682       
00683 }
00684

00687 
00688 int util_diff( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00689                char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00690                FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00691              )
00692 {
00693     
00694   if ( argc != 3 )
00695   {
00696     fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <expr1> <expr2>\n",argv[0]);
00697     return -1;
00698   }
00699   
00700   diff( output, argv[1], argv[2] );
00701   
00702   return 0;
00703   
00704 }

00707 
00708 /* counts the number of char and lines in a string.*/
00709 static void wc( FILE * output, char * str )
00710 {
00711   
00712   int nb_char = 0;
00713   int nb_NL = 0;
00714   char * curr = str;
00715   
00716   while ( *curr )
00717   {
00718     nb_char ++;
00719     if (*curr=='\n') nb_NL++;
00720     curr++;
00721   }
00722   
00723   fprintf(output, "%d %d\n",nb_char,nb_NL);
00724   
00725   return;
00726 }
00727 
00728 
00729 
00730 int util_wc( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00731              char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00732              FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00733             )
00734 {
00735   
00736   if ( argc != 2 )
00737   {
00738     fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <expr>\n",argv[0]);
00739     return -1;
00740   }
00741   
00742   wc( output, argv[1] );
00743   
00744   return 0;
00745   
00746 }

00748 
00749 
00750 int util_chomp( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00751                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00752                 FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00753               )
00754 {
00755   
00756   int len;
00757   char * in;
00758   char * out;
00759   
00760   if ( argc != 2 )
00761   {
00762     fprintf( output,"Usage: %s <expr>\n",argv[0]);
00763     return -1;
00764   }
00765   
00766   in = argv[1];
00767   
00768   len = strlen(in);
00769 
00770   if ( in[len-1] == '\n' )
00771   {
00772 
00773     out = (char *)Mem_Alloc(len+1);
00774     
00775     if ( out == NULL ) return Mem_Errno;
00776     
00777     /* local copy */
00778     strncpy(out,in, len+1);
00779     
00780     out[len-1] = '\0';
00781     
00782     fprintf( output, "%s", out);
00783     
00784     Mem_Free(out);
00785   
00786   }
00787   else
00788   {
00789     fprintf( output, "%s", in);
00790   }
00791   
00792   return 0;
00793   
00794 }
